title: My first visit to Europe:
author: Dickinson, Andrew
snippet: A tear stood in my eye, at the thought of finding Christian brethren, when lonely, and so far from home : I thought God sent him to me, and it would have been wrong to decline such singular hospitality. On entering Elm House, Prince's Park, I was struck by the luxurious beauty around. Mr. Maples introduced me to all his family, and their social grace relieved me from all embarrassment.
